section.title: The USB Filter Editor Interface

listitem.para:
Double-click the USB Filter Editor shortcut icon on your desktop.
Red Hat USB Filter Editor

section.para: The Red Hat USB Filter Editor interface displays the Class, Vendor, Product, Revision, and Action for each USB device. Permitted USB devices are set to Allow in the Action column; prohibited devices are set to Block.

row.entry: Type of USB device; for example, printers, mass storage controllers.
The manufacturer of the selected type of device.
Allow or block the specified device.

section.para: The USB device policy rules are processed in their listed order. Use the Up and Down buttons to move rules higher or lower in the list. The universal Block rule needs to remain as the lowest entry to ensure all USB devices are denied unless explicitly allowed in the USB Filter Editor.
